Title: Sa'di Surrenders his Arms to Two Indian Robbers
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper with gold-sprinkled margins
Description: On this folio from Walters manuscript W.618, Sa'di surrenders his arms to two Indian robbers.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Binding; Iran; Literature -- Poetry; Literature -- Prose
Provenance: Private collection, Tehran [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [list of books, by an anonymous owner, which were in his house in Tehran on fol. 1b]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Sa'di (died 691 AH/AD 1292)
